sn55.47:1.2: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to Nandiya the Sakyan:
sn55.47:1.3: “Nandiya, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.47:2.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.47:2.6: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.47:2.7: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
